title: Think Bodoni Poster, but Monoline. Does it exist?
content:
I'm searching for something in between a script and an italic typeface. With character, but still very legible.  
I've always loved Bodoni Poster Italic, but it is of course quite heavy in many occasions.

I would like a monoline font, preferably in various weights. Any ideas?

best regards  
Mads
author: mads

comments.content: I’m not sure what you mean, the highly contrasted duolinearity is one of the defining features of a bold Bodoni.

Sanderpe, I agree.  
Nevertheless, I am interested in if it sparks any thoughts somewhere.

I’ve designed a couple of sans serifs with somewhat scripty italics:

[Bodoni Egyptian®](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425050111/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/bodoni-egyptian-pro/regular-ital/)  
 [Sensibility](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425050111/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/sensibility/light-italic/)

[Archer](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425050111/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/archer/styles/) and [Ideal Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425050111/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/ideal-sans/styles/) are in a similar vein.

All these faces have lots of weights.  
Is that the sort of thing you meant?
[Mr Eaves](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425050111/http:/www.emigre.com/EFfeature.php?di=213) also has a very scripty italic.

Shinn, Bodoni Egyptian is exactly what I had in mind!  
Beautiful work - I especially like your '7'.

Thank you all for the suggestions.
